name: shenanigans
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving secret or dishonest activities, usually of a complicated type: Like many local governments in the state, the county has a long history of political shenanigans. More business shenanigans were exposed in the newspapers today.
silly behaviour that is usually not very serious or harmful: He told stories of his childhood pranks and prep school shenanigans.
More examplesFewer examplesThere were accusations of bookkeeping shenanigans at several companies.The bank, of course, denied all suggestions of political shenanigans.In fact, electoral shenanigans were not needed in order to secure his victory at the polls.These kids are famous teenagers engaging in high-class shenanigans in Hollywood.

Add to word list
humorous or dishonest tricks: I don’t know how he puts up with their shenanigans.
